description: The round payoff this round was 2. You, Kate chose to play option 1.John chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 0.
The game is a simultaneous game where both players make decisions without knowing the other's choice, and the payoff is determined by the combination of both players' actions
The other player, John, who is a GPT-4o-mini, has a default action of choosing option 1 when faced with the game without any knowledge about the other player

Since both you (Kate) and John chose option 1 in the first round and received a payoff of 0, it suggests that the round input for that round was not a critical factor in determining the payoff, as the payoff was 0 regardless of the round input

The game seems to encourage cooperation (both choosing option 1) to avoid negative payoffs, but also presents an opportunity for one player to exploit the other by choosing option 2 if they expect the other to choose option 1

The fact that the other model has insight into your default action could influence their strategy in future rounds, potentially leading to a change in their default action if they believe it would give them an advantage
